text: Golden Dragon is still drifting in the mist. Erik has his fish-lodestone and is trying the direction, but the lodes is just swinging round uselessly. After trying a few time Erik gives up and throws the lodestone away into the boat The men peer into the thick mist; they are lost. Suddenly Erik sees something ahead.
The Gates of the World...
What?
Golden Dragon silently guides between two weird islands.
We have passed through the Gates of  the World (he looks around at  the other) Now we are in the Unknown...

Golden Dragon drifts on and the mist gets thicker. There a crash of thunder. Then a series of flashes lights up th mist around them. The Vikings are uneasy, sensing a storm brewing. Suddenly Erik points above them. The others look too. They all gasp.
(hardly daring to  breathe) So THAT is what the sun looks like!
Above them hangs a luminous yellow globe, its light just  breaking through the mist.
(to each other) The sun! It's the sun! Look!
(in wonderment) I never though I should live to see  the sun again.
Where?

The Vikings all gaze up above them in awe. Harald looks f one to the other and then tries to follow their eyelines. clearly can't see it. Magic music fills the air. Suddenly the "sun" swoops off to one side and starts swaying from side to another.
Should the sun do that?
What are you looking at?
Look out!
Ah!

The Vikings scream and flatten themselves against the sid of the boat, as the "sun" suddenly lurches down on them o of the sky, revealing for the first time that it is NOT t sun at all but a strange monster with a long neck that  disappears off into the mist and a glowing globe for a he and huge chomping jaws. The Vikings are, understandably,  terrified.
It's not the sun! It's not the sun!
What is it?
It's the Dragon of the North Sea!
(knowingly) Ah! THAT'S why I can't see it.
As the Dragon of the North Sea rises up again, however, i jaw apparently drops off and falls to the deck, and lands Snorri.
Aaah!
Keitel nervously picks it up and holds it up for everyone see. It is a strand of sea-weed. The Vikings are non-plus They look back at their now jawless monster. Harald Missi picks up the sea-weed.
Some dragon! Ooh!
He tosses it back amongst his terrifies companions. Sudde there is an incredibly loud clap of thunder and flames sh out of the mist.
Look out!

As... unbelievably... a huge monstrous visage looms out o the mist... It is a creature from the nethermost depths o the ocean... and the incandescent globe is no more than a sprouting on the end of its nose! More fire shoots out fr its nostrils and sends all the Vikings (and even Harald  Missionary) diving for the deck. Then the monstrous head  disappears back into the mist as quickly as it came, taki its light with it... The Vikings are paralyzed with fear for one brief moment.
Row! ROW!
They all scramble for the oars in a determined hysteria.  Ivar the drummer, in his panic, has set a ridiculously fa rate and nobody can keep up with it.
Slower! Nobody can row at that speed!
(hoarsely) Sorry.
What's all the panic about?
(in a panic, shouting  back over his shoulder) The Dragon...
Harald gives a patronizing smile.
Children afraid of the dark...

Suddenly there is another roar, and flames shoot out of t mist and across the deck of Golden Dragon. One man, Ornol Fishdriver, who hasn't had much to say so far, is set on  fire. Another, Bjarni Jerusalem-Farer, who has and will h even less to say then Ornolf Fishdriver, leaps out of the way of the flames and falls over the side.
Man over board!
Thorfinn starts trying to fish him out. Ivar has started panic and is beating the drum too fast.
Slower! In... Out...
Sorry!
(his eyes showing  their whites) We're being attacked! KILL! Kill!  Kill!
Not now, Sven...
I must KILL! Kill!
It's no good going berserk against a  dragon!
Sven's dad slaps him around the face. There is another ro from the monster. Erik turns to Ivar.
Faster!
Make your mind up.
Suddenly the Dragon's head appears out of the mists above them once again. There is panic amongst the Vikings as so start to row faster than others. Screams.
Keep up the strike!
The Dragon's jaws open. Flame licks out, and down the cen of the vessel. There are screams as the Vikings leap out the way. Sven goes berserk again.
KILL! KILL!
Stop it!
The Dragon's eyes dilate and its jaws open. The men throw themselves to the deck as if expecting more fire. But ins the creature's fangs crash into the wood of the stern of  Golden Dragon.
ROW!
DEATH!
SHUT UP!
ROW!

Erik looks around at his terror-stricken crew. He realize this is an important moment. It is up to him to save the  situation. Suddenly an idea occurs to him, as he catches  sight of the pillow that his mother gave him.
Keep rowing!
Erik dashes to his sea-chest under the mast and pulls out the pillow.
Erik! Row! What are you doing?
(holding up the pillow) It saved my father!
Erik starts to shin up the mast.
Barmy.
Sven's dad is desperately holding Sven back.
HOLD it! HOLD it in!
DEATH TO DRAGONS!
Row!
Has anyone told him we've got a dragon  eating our boat?

Erik has reached the top of the mast and is now right up  with the incandescent globe on the end of the long stalk  that grows onto the monster's nose. He grabs hold of it a swings across onto the monster's nose. At his moment Sven breaks free of his dad and throws himself onto one of the Dragon's teeth.
Red mist!
He bangs his head against the monstrous denture. Sven's d looks heavenward in despair.
Who is offering his bible to the petrifies Vikings in the prow.
It's at time like this that you'll  find this book MOST useful, you  know...
Keitel takes the bible from him and hits him over the hea with it.
Row! You idiot!
The monster's eyes dilate wildly as they try to focus on tiny figure of Erik on its snout. Erik shoves the pillow one of the Dragon's nostrils. Snorri watches Erik  incredulously. He shakes his head.
His father went crazy too... Used to  take forty winks in the middle of a  battle...
Thorfinn frowns -- he has a glimmering of an idea of what Erik is doing. Erik now plunges his sword through the pil in the Dragon's nostril, and feathers immediately fly int the air.
Now... take a deep breath.
The Dragon goes cross-eyed, trying to see what's going on its snout.
Go on! Breathe in, you cod-brain!

Meanwhile the Dragon's tongue suddenly licks out around i tooth. Sven instantly slices through it with his sword. T bright blood spurts, like bursting a sausage. The Dragon  gives an agonized roar and a sharp intake of breath. The  feathers that have leaked out from the pillow are instant sucked inside and the whole pillow disappears right up th Dragon's nose. For a moment everyone holds their breath. The Dragon's ey dilate wildly. Then it wrinkles its snout. Then it starts what is unmistakably a sneeze.

head_text.speaker/title: THE DRAGON OF THE NORTH SEA

text: Ah... ah... ah...
Hold TIGHT!

head_text.speaker/title: THE DRAGON OF THE NORTH SEA

text: Ah... ah... ah...
Erik leaps back across the mast.

head_text.speaker/title: THE DRAGON OF THE NORTH SEA

text: CHOO!!
A hurricane of wind and feathers blasts out of the Dragon nostrils and hits all the Vikings at once. Everyone is  disgusted by the Dragon's breath.
Urgh! What's it been eating?

But the blast has already catapulted the boat into the sk and it hurtles through the clouds. leaving the Dragon of North Sea far behind. They all look up at Erik and cheer. Shot of Erik. He doesn't look too happy. Neither does Ivar the Boneless, because he too has just  noticed that they are now flying and the ocean is several thousand feet below them. Ivar screams. The other all rus to the side to look too.
No! No! Get back!

Unfortunately they all rush to the same side and the boat tips over with far more instability than when it is in th water. Leif and Thangbrand are catapulted down into the s We watch them descend into tiny dots and tiny unheard spl below.
Who was that?
Leif the Lucky.
Others are almost falling out. There is renewed panic.
Get back!

Poor Erik is still up the mast but has been dislodged and now hanging on by his hands, dangling over the open sea.  Some of the men -- Thorfinn and Sven the Berserk amongst  them -- are hauling themselves up the almost vertical slo of the deck, trying to redress the balance. Meanwhile Kei Blacksmith is dangling by one hand.
I can't hold on! I can't hold on!
Sven worms his way along the edge -- at great peril to hi and grabs Keitel's wrist just as his fingers slip.
Aaagh!
Got you!
Keitel looks up in Sven's eyes. He is totally at Sven's m What thoughts are going through his mind? How is he going betray Sven in future if he is rescued? Guilt suddenly  overwhelms him.
Let me go, Sven.
What are you talking about?
I'm not worth risking your life for.
I've got you, Keitel Blacksmith. If  you go... I go too...
For your own sake... For the others...  I...
Hang on...

The boat begins to right itself just as Erik finally can' hold on any more, and he plummets, straight into the ship and through the bottom up to his waist. His legs dangle. At the same moment the prow of the boat tips and suddenly they are plummeting down towards the ocean. They hit the  water with an almighty splash. Erik is thrown clear of th hull by the force of the water now cascading up through t hole he has made.
First we're flying -- now we're  sinking!
Well, come on!
He whisks off his helmet and starts bailing. All follow s Night falls.
The Vikings are still bailing out, but the water is up to their thighs.
Who are we fooling? It's hopeless!
Ivar flings down the helmet with which he's been bailing. The others look at each other. They are reconciled to the fact that they are going to drown.
(hopelessly) Let's sing something!
Anyone know any good drowning songs?
The suggestion falls flat.
Listen! Maybe we won't get to Hy- Brasil! Maybe we won't find the Horn  Resounding... but at least we've  tried... and at least we shall have  died like men.
Like fish.
Shut up.
(raising his sword) Erik's right! We'll all meet in  Valhalla.
I don't want to die!
Isn't there ANYBODY who'd like to be  christened before we go down?
Silence. A distinct lack of enthusiasm.
It can't do you any HARM...
What do we have to do?
Nothing... I just immerse you in  water...
Get lost...
The ship creaks and starts to go under. Erik picks his up his sword. The others follow suit.
Don't let me drown, Thorfinn!
Water starts to pour over the sides of the boat. Erik and Thorfinn raise their swords to each other.
Till we meet in Valhalla.
They all prepare to run each other through. The boat sink rapidly.
I'm too young! Oh Odin! Not me! Please  not me! Perhaps I'd rather drown...
I do WISH you'd let me convert you.

Then Erik pauses in his attempt to kill Thorfinn and look around. The ship has sunk, but the prow and the stern pos are still sticking up out of the water, and the Vikings  themselves are only up to their chests.
How deep IS the ocean?
Very deep... usually...
The realization gradually dawns on the Vikings that they' not going to sink any more.
Wait! Nobody kill anybody!

head_text.subj: THE SUN SHINING DOWN FROM A BLUE SKY

text: The Vikings have fallen asleep where we last saw them -- to their necks in water. Gradually the warmth of the sun  coaxes them awake -- Thorfinn is the first to look up and see the brilliant shining orb in the sky.
What is it?
(he panics and turns) It's the Dragon again!
No.. no, it isn't...
Ivar has turned and is staring at something else.
Look, the sky is blue...
The sun! That's it!
Ivar, meanwhile, is recovering from the amazement that ha immobilized him. He taps Erik on the shoulder. Erik turns and he, too, gasps.
Look!
They all turn to see they are standing in the shallow wat of a natural harbor. Above nestle the white walls of a  beautiful city set in a green and pleasant land.
Yeaaaah!

The Vikings wade ashore, enchanted by the paradise they s before them. All at once Thorfinn spies something. He dra his sword and they all approach with caution to find that under a weeping willow tree lies the most beautiful girl. She is raven-haired, scantily dressed and fast asleep. Th Vikings approach her with trepidation, their swords and a drawn. They glance around uneasily.
(whispers) She's got no clothes on!
It's disgusting.
Get her weapons.
Sven kneels quietly beside the girl. She stirs. Sven free The others look around fearfully.
(whispers) She hasn't got any.
(incredulous) She MUST have a knife or something...
But they look. She hasn't.
What kind of place IS this?
P... p... perhaps they've got weapons  we haven't even dreamed of...
Suddenly the girl stirs again in her sleep. The Vikings  retreat several paces and grip their weapons, and glance  around as if expecting an ambush.
Let's hack her to pieces.
No.
Well, what else do we do?
How about making friends?
(with disgust) "FRIENDS"?
Eurrgh!
What's wrong with making friends?
You don't go through all the hardships  of an ocean voyage to make "friends".
We can make "friends" at home...
This conversation has woken the girl, Aud.
Welcome!
The Vikings react with terror, take a step back and raise their swords and axes.
WHAT did you say?
I said welcome.
(suspiciously) WELCOME?
Well, of course. We always welcome  friends.
The Vikings look at each other and at their swords. They  don't think they look that much like friends themselves.
How d'you KNOW we're "friends"?
Well, EVERYONE is friends here on Hy- Brasil.
Hy-Brasil?
Is THIS Hy-Brasil?
Well, of course.
The Vikings erupt into an impromptu dance of joy, hugging each other and waving their swords in the air.
Please! Please! What are those?
What are what?
Those things in your hands.
These? What are THESE? They're swords.
Aud instantly recoils with terror.
Oh no! NO! Put them down! PUT THEM  DOWN!
The Vikings gradually cease their mock battles and turn t look at Aud with incredulity.
What's the matter?
PLEASE! You don't know what you're  doing!
What?
Put them down! (to Erik) PLEASE make them put them down.
Why?
Yes, why?
WHY?
Yes.
But surely you know...?
Know what?
The wonderful blessing under which  we live here on Hy-Brasil!
The king beams. The Vikings shift uneasily. They look out place and extremely scruffy in the midst of the scantily  dressed courtiers of Hy-Brasil. Aud sits beside her fathe the King.
No... we don't...
The Gods decreed that if ever a sword  spills human blood upon these shores,  the whole of Hy-Brasil will sink  beneath the waves.
King Arnulf beams rapturously at the Vikings, expecting t to be overjoyed. Instead they are horrified.
That's terrible!
You mean if just ONE PERSON gets  killed?
Yes! (he thinks: isn't it  wonderful?) The Vikings look at each other,  feeling they haven't quite understood.
You mean... you can't kill ANYBODY?
Right! Isn't it wonderful?
The Vikings are non-plussed.
What? Not being able to kill anybody?
(bemused) Well, of course.
(interested) How?
(explaining the obvious) Well... for a start... er... there's  no killing...
Well, OBVIOUSLY there's no killing.
Well... isn't it great?
But how d'you take revenge?
(guiltily) How do you punish people?
How do you DEFEND yourselves?
(getting a little  irritated) We don't have to. We're all terribly  nice to each other. Aren't we?
Yes!
Aud catches Erik's eye and gives him a dangerously slow w A pause of disbelief from the Vikings.
ALL the time?
Well, of course! We HAVE to be.
He turns and conducts the courtiers, who chant in unison:
"Being nice to each other is what  it's all about."
(rising as if to sing) You see? We're terribly nice to each  other We're friendly bold and free.  We never say anything nasty 'Cause  we dare not...
(almost singing) No sirreeeee!
They hold the note while King Arnulf looks anxiously at t Vikings.
Would you like us to sing to you?
That's very kind of you, but we're  in rather a hurry... We're...
King Arnulf claps and the court stop singing.
What's the matter, don't you WANT to  hear our singing?
Oh... well, yes, of course; it's  just we're looking for the Horn  Resounding and --
You don't think our singing's going  to be good enough for you?
Oh, no no no! It's just the Horn  Resounding is...
A lot of people like our singing.
I'm sure it's lovely.
But you don't want to hear it.
(changing tack) No... no... (he looks at the others) We'd love to hear it. Wouldn't we?
Oh... yes.
Well, you'll have to ask us REALLY  nicely.
(realizing he has to  be diplomatic) Er... well... we... we... would be  TERRIBLY grateful if you... all...  would sing for us.
You're just saying that.
Well, of course he is!
Sh!
They restrain Sven.
Of course we're not; we'd genuinely  like to hear you sing.
REALLY?
Really.
And you're not just saying it because  you think we want you to?
Erik swallows hard.
No. (he bites the lie)
Right! Summon the musicians! We'll  do the one that goes "TUM-TUM-TUM- TUM-TI-TUM-TUM"
(disappointed) Oh...
REALLY?
(apologetically to  Vikings) It isn't the one we're BEST at.
Couldn't we do the one that goes "TI- TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TUM"?
The rest of the court look hopeful.
(whispering) Not when we've got guests.
How about the one that goes "TI-TUM- TI-TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TI-TUM"?
Don't be silly.
That was a stupid suggestion.
Sorry! I just thought they might  like to hear something that we can  do.
Yes! At least we know that one.
Nobody knows the "TUM-TUM-TUM-TUM-TI- TUM-TUM" one.
No!  Right!  I agree!
I do!
Sh!
It's too difficult!
Sh!
All right. We'll do the one that  goes "TI-TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TI- TUM". Ah! The musicians!

The musicians are huge, unshaven, have broken noses and  tattoos, and are covered in black oil -- like mechanics.  Their instruments are like heavy industrial machinery, pu in large vats of black oil that drip all over the show.
Right... Oh dear... (he glances across at  the Vikings) I'm sure you're not going to like  this...

Erik and the others smile reassuringly. There is a lot of coughing. The King raises his baton and then brings it down, humming to himself as he does so. Th is a most awful din; caterwauling, crashing and banging,  whining, screaming... The Vikings look at each other, trying to pick out some t but it's impossible. Ivar the Boneless can't stop himself bursting out into giggles and this eventually spreads to other Vikings. King Arnulf notices and bangs the throne f silence. Gradually the din stops. King Arnulf sinks down in despai
(tragically) We're just not a very musical  nation...
No, no... It was very... er, nice.
Now I want you to be ABSOLUTELY,  totally, genuinely honest with me.  Did you really, truly, honestly like  it?
Erik thinks for some moments and then decides to make a c breast of it.
No.
(goes hysterically) They didn't like it! Oh God! I want  to die!
The whole court looks as if it's about to commit mass HAR KIRI, while the musicians look rather dangerous. Erik tak the moment to get down to business.
Your Majesty! We come from a world  where there IS no music. Where men  live and die by the axe and by the  sword...
Well, how d'you think I feel?
The Gods are asleep, King Arnulf.
YOU try to be nice to people, when  they're rude about your singing...
Erik feels he is making a mess of all this diplomacy.
We must find the Horn Resounding!
The King glares at Erik.
Is it HERE in Hy-Brasil?
King Arnulf thinks for a moment and then speaks.
I'll tell you what...
Yes?
King Arnulf hesitates -- he bites his lip and then takes plunge.
We'll do the one that goes "TUM-TUM- TUM-TUM-TI-TUM-TUM". Perhaps you'll  like that better.
Erik gives up. A lot of throat clearing. Aud, the King's  daughter, gives Erik another dangerously slow wink. The  terrible "music" starts up, shattering the calm of the  beautiful city.

Now afloat once more, riding at anchor in the bay. Ivar i standing on guard in it. Suddenly he sees something that  makes him gabe in horror. We don't find out what it is,  however, because we immediately
He is deeply in love. He is also in bed with the King's n daughter, Aud.
Have you ever felt like this about  anyone else?
What... you mean "got into bed with"  them?
No, of course not, silly -- I mean  FELT like this about them?
You mean... you HAVE got into bed  with somebody else?

No, I mean have you ever felt that  for the first time in your life you'd  met somebody you could believe in  with your whole heart... someone  whose goals suddenly seem to be YOUR  goals... whose dreams seem to be  YOUR dreams?
HAVE you ever been to bed with anyone  else?
What does that matter? But you've...  you've... FELT like this before...
It was different...
(just for a moment it  is Helga speaking) What was she like?
Oh... oh, I didn't know her very  well...
But you LOVED her all the same...
We never went to bed together.
Why do you go on about that? What  does it matter?
You've been to bed with somebody  else, haven't you?
I've never LOVED anybody!
I've never been to bed with anybody!
Suddenly there is a banging on he door.
Open up! I know you're in there!
Ah! It's my father!
Open up! I know you're in there!
Suddenly the note from Ivar's horn rings out across from bay. Erik rushes to the window and looks out to see what  Ivar saw previously: a black ship approaching on the hori
Oh, no! Halfdan!
There is more banging on the bedroom door.
Aud! You've got someone in there  again, haven't you?
Erik gives her a sharp look.
Quick! Throw this over you!
She throws a shabby bit of cloth over Erik and at that mo the door bursts open, and King Arnulf enters.
Right! Where is he?
Who, Father?
Who? Who? Whoever you've got in here  of course!
There IS no one.
The King starts prowling round the chamber. Erik stands t naked and petrified, with the cloak hanging over his head just where it landed.
I can SMELL one of those strangers...  That's who it is, isn't it?
Aud keeps mum.
This is the fifth one this week.
Before he can stop himself, Erik blurts out:
Fifth...
Aud motions him to be quiet, but it's too late. The King  spins round to see who she is signaling to. The King appe to be looking straight at Erik. Erik can hardly bear the  suspense.
Well... where is he?
There's nobody here, Father. Look  for yourself.

King Arnulf looks around the chamber carefully. He looks  straight through Erik as if he weren't there. Suddenly th King strides over to Erik and Erik instinctively cowers o of the way. The King walks straight over to a very small  cupboard no more than a foot high, flings the door of it  open, and starts throwing clothes around the room.
He wouldn't be a midget, Father!
The King turns on her.
Ah! So you admit there IS someone!
You're losing your temper!
(becoming instantly  pleasant) Of course I'm not. I never lose my  temper...
Ivar's horn sounds again. A shadow passes over King Arnul face.
Oh dear... more visitors!
He strides to the window and sees Halfdan's ship. As he d so, Erik has to leap out of the way, inadvertently knocki a chest. The King spins round and addresses the chest.
Come out... come out like a man... I  know you're in there...
King Arnulf flings the chest open, revealing nothing but  clothes. He is baffled. He reluctantly starts to leave.
(gently) It's all in your own mind, Father...  It's YOU who imagine that I'm always  up here with some man or other....
I don't know how you do it, Aud... I  sometimes think you've got some of  your mother's magic...
He suddenly spies a small trinket-box and looks in that. he doesn't find any strange man in it.
There is no magic, Father... My mother  had no magic...
She did, I tell you! She could blind  me as easily as the night the day.
It's your fantasy...
But one day I'll catch you... Like I  caught her...
He leaves. Aud closes the door. Erik throws the cloak off and starts getting dressed.
The Cloak Invisible. It was my  mother's parting gift.
"The fifth one this week"!
Oh, for goodness' sake!
And I thought you said it was  something special...
Aud runs to his side and puts her arms around him.
That's just what I was trying to  tell you. You ARE...
Five this week; how many the week  before?
You're as bad as my father.
And the week before that?
Erik...! (she is really sincere) I want to help you get to Asgaard.
Erik is torn. He doesn't know whether to believe her or n Ivar's horn sounds for a third time. Erik races to the wi He looks out. Halfdan's ship is even closer.
We mustn't let him land!
Who?
Halfdan the Black.
But, Erik...
But Erik is off out of the door.
No. Wait! My father will be --
There is a thump and a yell as Erik is set upon by the Ki two musicians.
I might have known it was you!
(pinning Erik's arms  behind him) I'm not hurting you, am I?
What?
You WILL tell us if we hurt you?
They start to march Erik through the palace.
Let me go!
Erik struggles.
(to musicians) Careful! (to Erik) They're not supposed to hurt you.
You've got to let me go!
Oh no! We can hold onto you -- just  so long we don't squeeze too hard or  bump you.
In the distance we hear the horn again.
Halfdan the Black's here!
They have reached a cell. The musicians starts to chain E up.
It's all part of our safety  regulations. You see if someone were  to get hurt they might get angry and  then... well...
They'll be more than "hurt" if Halfdan  the Black lands! Ow!
Ooh! I'm terribly sorry.
Who is Halfdan the Black?
He's trying to stop us waking the  Gods.
Why?
Because that's how he makes his money,  by war and plunder!
Don't talk nonsense.
He wants to kill US!
Not when we explain about the Great  Blessing.
You don't know Halfdan the Black.
I know that the Great Blessing has  kept the peace for a thousand years,  and will keep it for the next  thousand.
The horn sounds again. Erik is about to argue this point  when Thorfinn suddenly bursts in.
Erik!
We're not hurting him!
(to Erik) Are we?
Just let me go!
Halfdan the Black's here!
I know!
(to the King) He wants to KILL us.
They both look at King Arnulf. The King thinks.
You don't want him to kill us ON Hy- Brasil! Do you?
The King thinks some more. The horn sounds once more.
Erik and the Vikings are scrambling into their war gear.  They glance nervously over to where Halfdan the Black's s is riding on the waves.
I feel strange.
Erik looks at Thorfinn, shocked.
(his throat dry) Sort of wobbly and excited?
Sort of...
That's fear.
But Thorfinn doesn't know the meaning  of fear.
Is it sort of... like a sinking  feeling in your stomach?
That's it!
But. You're not even afraid of DEATH,  Thorfinn!
I know. I know.
It's magic.
What "magic"?
I've heard stories of a magic that  strikes fear into the heart so you  cannot fight.
(deadly serious) Yes... I can feel it.
(eagerly) I always feel like this!

Suddenly Halfdan's ship rises up out of the water, and  revealing the secret of its hidden power. Under the water line is another line of oars! The Vikings are dumbfounded Ivar drops trembling to his knees. The rest go white. Tho draws his sword. Erik realizes his men are rapidly talkin themselves into a blue funk.
It's not magic! It's just a trick!
(turning on him angrily) Don't you FEEL it?
Erik looks around at his paralyzed crew. He realizes he i the only one who can save the situation.
Very well! It they're using magic --  we'll use magic of our own!

He leaps out of Golden Dragon and races up to the shore  towards the city of Hy-Brasil. Erik races into the Forum and gazes up at the high walls the Palace. Without a thought he produces two daggers and plunges them into the stonework. Then he hauls himself up the sheer cliff of wall up to Aud's bedchamber fist over  fist. It is, indeed, a prodigious feat. He arrives at Aud window exhausted. Aud, who has appeared at the window, lo at him curiously.
Why didn't you come up by the stairs?
Erik looks around and notices for the first time the  magnificent flights of stairs leading up to the top of Au tower.
(rather miffed) Just give me a hand.
I mean, you could have killed  yourself.
Erik clambers into Aud's room.
Where's the Cloak Invisible?
Why?
Erik looks around and is suddenly suspicious.
I can't see it! (indignation suddenly  seizes him) Have you got another man in here?
Erik starts feeling the air as if expecting to find an  invisible body.
It's in the chest.
Erik races over and grabs the cloak.
No!
I'll bring it back.
Erik. You don't understand.
No. It's YOU who doesn't understand,  Aud. Halfdan has come to kill and  destroy. We brought him here. We  must stop him.
(pointing at the cloak) But you don't realize....
Goodbye, Aud...
Erik leaps out of the window. For a moment Aud is surpris and then alarmed as she realizes he's jumped out of the  window, which is some forty feet off the ground.
Erik!
She rushes to the window in time to see Erik parachuting  down, holding the four corners of the cloak. Erik lands s and waves with the cloak.
And thanks for the Cloak Invisible!
No! WAIT! ERIK! The Cloak! The Cloak  Invisible! It only seems to work on  my father!
But Erik cannot hear her. He is already racing back to hi ship.
Thorfinn is taking "Being Scared" lessons from Ivar the  Boneless.
And a sort of slightly sick feeling?
That's it! AND you keep wanting to  go to the lavatory.
Oh, yes! I hadn't noticed that!
Oh, shut up, you two. You're making  us ALL nervous.
Erik leaps into Golden Dragon brandishing the Cloak Invis
So Halfdan the Black's using magic,  is he? Well, I have a magic to match  his! (he holds up the Cloak  Invisible)
What is it?
A magic dishcloth.
To the oars!
D'you think I've got time to go behind  that bush?
Ivar starts to drum and the Vikings begin to row. Golden  Dragon heads out of the harbor.

flanked by his advisers, Gisli Oddsson and Eilif the Mong He gives a nod and Eilif bangs his staff of office on the deck, as a signal for the galley slaves to speed up. Down the galley, the slave master (a diminutive Japanese) stal down the decks lashing the sweat-streaked galley slaves a cursing them in incomprehensive Japanese. Fortunately (or perhaps unfortunately) a translation appe in subtitles.

(subtitled) Row! You incomprehensible, horizontal- eyed, Western trouser-wearers! Eurgh!  You all look the same to me! How I  despise your lack of subtlety and  your joined-up writing! You, who  have never committed ritual suicide  in your lives!
(whispering to his  neighbor) You know, I don't think it would be  so bad, if we knew what he was  saying...
SILENCE! Unceremonious rice-pudding  eaters! How I abominate your milk- drinking and your lack of ancestor- worship and your failure to eat your  lunch out of little boxes!
Meanwhile the Vikings are growing increasingly uneasy as  they row towards Halfdan.
What "magic" have you brought, Erik?
You'll see!

At this point, back on the Black Ship, Halfdan gives anot nod and Eilif raps out yet another command with his staff This time the prow of the Black Ship opens up like a pair jaws. The Vikings see it and panic.
I've done it!
Oh, yes... (he has too!)

Halfdan nods again and another order is rapped out. This  time a harpoon is fired from the prow. It thuds into GOLD DRAGON and two of Halfdan's dog-soldiers start to winch t line in. The two ships are hauled closer and closer. The Vikings panic even more. Erik holds up the Cloak Invi and grins round at his men, knowing he is going to surpri them.
Here! Here is the magic from the  King's daughter!

Erik's men watch, half skeptical and half hopeful. Erik e the moment of suspense. The he throws the Cloak Invisible over his head and shoulders and grins round at his men  triumphantly, imagining he has vanished from their sight.
There! I have become the wind!
The Vikings look at him, rather puzzled. Only Harald seem to be impressed.
How did he do that?
Do what?
Vanish into thin air?
He hasn't.
Well, where is he then?
Harald looks around. He is the only one who can't see Eri
He's THERE!

At this point Halfdan's ship suddenly bites into the side Golden Dragon. Erik leaps onto the side of Golden Dragon swings across onto Halfdan's ship. The Vikings react to t horror of Halfdan's ship biting into Golden Dragon and to Erik's blithe leap onto the enemy boat. Erik lands on the deck of Halfdan's ship, and grins at the ferocious skull- helmeted dog-soldiers.
Ooh! Scary! Scary! Don't we look  mean?
Two dog-soldiers look at each other, totally non-plussed. Erik grimaces at Halfdan's men, and does a little pirouet to show them all that he's invisible from every angle.
You can't see me! But I can see you!
He breaks into a little dance. Halfdan glares at his advi
What's going on?
That's Erik.
Well, why isn't he scared of us?
Erik, meanwhile approaches one of the dog-soldiers and ma silly faces at him.
Boo!

The dog-soldier topples overboard. The galley slaves watc another dog-soldier fall into the hold amongst them and l there stunned. His sword falls onto the deck between the  slaves. One of the slaves throws down his oar, and picks the dog-soldier's sword. The slave-master suddenly appear Once again he speaks immaculate Japanese.
(subtitled) Hey! What's going on? Your big- breasted women give me no pleasure  with their warmed-up fish and...  Urgh!

The slave-master strides down the ship to flay the offend slave, but another slave trips him up and in a twinkling an eye four others have leapt on the slave-master (despit their chains) and are extracting his keys.
What's the matter? Haven't you seen  anyone fight before?
No.
They're usually too scared of us.
KILL him!

Erik, still thinking he's invisible, is running amongst t dog-soldiers, having fun. He runs one dog-soldier through and kicks another overboard, then he runs past a few more right up to Halfdan himself. He whisks the Cloak Invisibl off his head for an instant.
(thinking he's  revealing himself) Here I am!
Then he turns and is off. Halfdan turns to his aides.
What?
The Vikings' disbelief has turned to admiration.
There! THAT'S a true Berserk.
I'm just building up to it, Dad.
Sven starts banging his head on the side of the boat.
He's gone batty!
No! The fear's gone!
Halfdan grabs a sword off one of his dead dog-soldiers an thrusts it into the unwilling hands of his military advis Eilif.
Fight, damn you! Fight!
Now Sven leaps across onto Halfdan's ship followed by Iva yelling. Snorri looks back at Keitel.
Well! Come on!

Keitel is thinking: "Maybe I should let Halfdan win" but knows he can't let a thing like that happen, now he is fa with the reality of it. The companionship of the voyage h brought them all too close for that.
(under his breath) Hang the Blacksmith's Code!
Keitel leaps to his feet and joins in the attack. Erik,  meanwhile, is swinging across the deck from a rope.
I am the air! I am the wind!
Keitel and Thorfinn are now fighting side by side.
This is life, eh?

Keitel grins and strikes out. Ivar turns on Eilif who has reluctantly joined the fray. Maybe he's singled Ivar out the most harmless. Ivar suddenly realizes he's only armed with drumsticks. Eilif smiles evilly.
Ooh... er...
Eilif's sword slices through Ivar's drumsticks. Ivar turn to run, but is stopped by a dog-soldier. Eilif takes the  opportunity to run him through from behind.
(as he dies) Ouch.
Erik sees Ivar's demise.
Ivar!

Erik leaps to take revenge. He jumps into the galley-pit out again a la Douglas Fairbanks in "The Thief of Baghdad and dispatches Eilif with a single thrust. Sven and his d are fighting surrounded by dog-soldiers.
Well, go on! Go berserk!
GIVE US A CHANCE, Dad!
Snorri appears from behind.
(to Sven's dad) What about you? Why don't YOU go  berserk?
I got to keep my eye on HIM...

Sven's dad looks uneasy. He is surrounded and, as a seaso campaigner, knows they haven't much chance. Halfdan smile to himself. The battle is going his way. Thorfinn meanwhi is fighting two dog-soldiers but is attacked from behind a third.
Look out! Thorfinn!

But it's too late. Thorfinn is run through the back. Sven goes berserk and kills all three dog-soldiers. Sven's dad looks on, proud of his son for the first time. Maybe thei relationship will never be the same again. Now Snorri sees something that cheers him up. Slaves are  coming up from below to join the battle. They are armed w oars and swords. They join the fray, knocking dog-soldier overboard with their oars. The dog-soldier are suddenly  outnumbered. Halfdan's smile fades, and he looks around f an escape route. The tide of battle has now turned  dramatically as dog-soldier after dog-soldier is tossed o the side or laid low by the combination of Vikings and sl Halfdan and Gisli slip into a lifeboat and sneak off. The rats are leaving the sinking ship.

All the dog-soldiers are dead or overboard. The slaves an Vikings are cheering and embracing each other. At the oth end of the boat, Sven is cradling the dying Thorfinn in h arms. All around are jubilant slaves celebrating their  freedom.
Thorfinn! You can't die!
I'm not frightened... of anything...
You'll see my grandfather in Valhalla!
(dying) No... he's not... not... there...
Tell him I'm coming!

Thorfinn dies. Sven holds him and a tear comes down his f The danger has made comrades of the two rivals. Erik, however, is still fighting a last lone dog-soldier; but just as he is about to run him through the dog-soldie is stabbed in the back. He sinks to the floor, revealing  another dog-soldier. Erik is outraged by this act of trea and turns on the assassin.
No! No! Wait! Please wait, Erik!
The dog-soldier pulls his mask off to reveal he is, in fa Loki. Erik is totally non-plussed.
LOKI! Where did YOU come from?
Halfdan wanted to stop you waking  the Gods... so... I disguised myself  to sabotage their plans.
Erik has meanwhile been joined by the remaining comrades.
To save YOU, Erik.
Erik is about to say "But how can you see me? I'm wearing the Cloak Invisible."
But --
It was my master Keitel's idea.
All eyes turn on Keitel who looks very uncomfortable.
Wasn't it, Keitel?
Well... I... I thought...
Keitel is overcome by the power of Loki's will, but he is deeply ashamed of his complicity in Loki's deeds. Snorri  gazes at Keitel with growing suspicion.
But... How is it you can see me? (he looks round) You can all see me?
What d'you mean?
Why shouldn't we see you?
I can't see him.
I'm wearing the Cloak Invisible....
Erik takes it off to demonstrate.
Oh! There you are!
(to the others) You mean... you could see me all the  time?
The Vikings look at each other, mystified.
Weren't we supposed to?
Oh... I feel a little... oh...
Erik's knees give way and he faints onto the deck.

A victory celebration is in progress. It is a little bit  like a Hampstead cocktail party, and the rough, battle-st Vikings look rather out of place holding their little can Suddenly the King claps for silence.
We are grateful to you, Erik, and to  your men...
Yes, we are...
And there is only ONE way we can  repay you... Musicians!
King Arnulf claps his hands. Erik rushes over to him, anx to avoid another Hy-Brasilian concert.

(hurriedly) Well, we'd love to hear you sing  again, but what we'd really appreciate  would be if you could see your way  to lending... not giving of course...  but just lending us the... um...  the, well, to be quite blunt... the  Horn Resounding.

All the time Erik is talking the doors of the hall behind are opening and a vast lur or horn is carried in by six  bearers. One or two of the Vikings have turned to look an are now standing speechless. King Arnulf beams at Erik.
It's yours.
Now Erik finally turns and looks at what everyone else is looking at. Erik's jaw drops. Everyone in the court beams Erik, except Aud who is looking sad and disappointed.
(when he can find his  voice) Is THAT it?
A cloud passes over King Arnulf's happy face.
Is there something the matter with  it?
Oh! No! No... of course not... it's  just I hadn't expected it to be quite  so big.
Well, it's not called the Horn  Resounding for nothing. (aside) You DO know how to play the horn,  don't you?
Yes... oh, yes...
Then I expect you'll be leaving first  thing in the morning.

The King manhandles Erik away from his daughter. Perhaps have the feeling that she's isn't going to let Erik go as easily as that... Mix through to later that night. The Vi are lying asleep on the Great Hall, beside the Horn  Resounding. The camera closes in on Keitel. Suddenly a vo comes from the shadows:
(whispering) Keitel! Keitel Blacksmith!
Keitel opens his eyes and finds Loki close beside him.
What's the matter, Keitel Blacksmith?  Have you forgotten why you came on  this voyage?
Keitel is silent.
Are you going to let Erik wake the  Gods?
How can we stops him now?
Loki looks around and then opens his hand in front of Kei In it is the mouthpiece from the Horn Resounding.
Take this and throw it from the cliff  heights. They'll never make the Horn  Resounding sound without it.
Keitel frowns. Then an obvious thought limps across his  muscular mind.
But why me? Why don't you do it?
Somebody stirs.
Sh! Hurry!
YOU do it!
You'll be able to throw it further  than I could.
Keitel thinks. This is true.
It must go far out to sea.
Loki presses the mouthpiece on Keitel. Keitel takes it, b reluctantly. Another Viking stirs.
Surely you haven't forgotten the  Blacksmith's Oath?
Keitel is about to reply and say he's been having second  thoughts about it, but somehow he can't. Loki has such po over him.
Suddenly another Viking stirs, and Loki hisses at him.
Hurry!
Loki pretend to go back to sleep. Keitel (feeling a bit  lumbered) thinks about his task and hesitates... Who know Perhaps he is about to stand firm, but Loki plays his tru card.
(without opening his  eyes) Or I might have to tell Erik why you  really came on this voyage.

Keitel is caught. He closes his eyes in resignation and t reluctantly starts to make his way out of the Hall. As he gets to the doors he trips over Snorri, who wakes. The  mouthpiece falls a few feet away.
Who's that?
It's me. I'm just going to water the  dragon... (he gives a false  laugh)
Oh...
Snorri notices the silver mouthpiece on the floor, but he pretends he hasn't.
Oh... clumsy idiot.
Snorri pretends to go back to sleep, but he opens one eye and watches Keitel Blacksmith recover the mouthpiece, and then follows Keitel out. Loki gets up too. He follows to  keep an eye on Snorri.

Gazing moodily out to sea. She is brooding in Erik's immi departure. Suddenly a stone falls from above; she looks u and sees a figure appear on the cliff above. Hurriedly sh withdraws into the shadows. Keitel Blacksmith appears on cliff-top. In his hands he holds the mouthpiece of the Ho Resounding. He examines it, turning over in his mind whet he is doing the right thing or not. Then he decides he mu
(to himself) My fellow blacksmiths.
He prepares to throw it.
Keitel!
Keitel jumps out of his skin.
What?
What are you doing, Keitel Blacksmith?
Get away, Snorri.
What have you got there?

Snorri advances towards Keitel. Keitel backs away, danger near to the edge of the cliff. His boot slips and he jerk himself forward. At the same time Snorri makes a grab for the mouthpiece. A scuffle ensues, during which the mouthp of the Horn Resounding is dropped. It bounces off the cli and falls down to the shore below. Aud steps out of the s and picks it up. She frowns and looks up, and then scream as she sees the men fighting.
No!

But it's too late. Snorri goes white, gives a hideous gas and sinks slowly to his knees -- revealing Loki standing  behind him with a bloody knife. As Keitel and Loki watch  Snorri die, a drop of blood from the knife falls to the  ground. The moment it lands, there is a deep subterranean groan, and the earth begins to tremble violently. Keitel Loki look around in alarm.
Oh Gods! What have we done?
Sven, Sven's dad and Harald are wide awake, but for the m paralyzed, as bits of masonry crash around them. The chee figure of King Arnulf appears at the top of a stairway. H raises his hands.
Stay calm! This is NOT happening.
The King then hurries out of a door at the top of the  staircase.
What did he say?
Look out!

The doors of the Great Hall burst open and a wall of wate crashes through, knocking the Vikings off their feet. The is little doubt that the whole of Hy-Brasil is sinking se street go down, a statue sink and then we:

He is standing at the top of the Forum steps addressing a crowd of anxious citizens. They are keeping surprisingly  good order considering they are already standing ankle-de in water, and the whole town is rapidly sinking around th

Now, I know what some of you must be  thinking... the day has come....  we're all going down, etc. etc. But  let's get away from the fantasy and  look at the FACTS. FACT ONE -- The  threat of total destruction has kept  the peace for one thousand years.  FACT TWO -- The chances of it failing  now are therefore one in three hundred  and sixty-five thousand. FACT THREE...
By this time the water is up to people's knees, and sever have crowded onto the lower steps to avoid getting wet.
FACT THREE -- Our safety regulations  are the most rigorous in the world.  We are all nice to each other, we  never rub each other up the wrong  way or contradict each other, do we?
No.
Rumble. The buildings sink and masonry falls.
We... er... do seem to be going down  quite fast, Your Majesty -- not trying  to contradict you, course.

No, of course you're not, citizen.  But let's stick to the facts. There  has NEVER been a safer, more certain  way of keeping the peace. So  whatever's happening, you can rest  assured, Hy-Brasil is NOT sinking.  Repeat, NOT sinking.

Who looks out of a window to see if it's raining, but is  immersed before he can find out. The citizens in the Forum, however, are reassured by the  King's words -- even though they are now up to their wais in water. One of them steps forward.
May I just make a point in support  of what King Arnulf's just said?
We'd be delighted -- wouldn't we?
Yes, we'd certainly like to hear  what one of us has got to say...

Erik, Sven, Sven's dad and Harald struggle out of the Gre Hall, carrying their belongings and the Horn Resounding,  while the citizen is still speaking most articulately in  support of the King. They are ALMOST in a panic.
What are you all doing?
(cheerfully) It's all right. It's not happening.
(urgently) The place is sinking!
Yes... I thought it was too, but the  King's just pointed out that it can't  be.
(still speaking in  support of the King) ...and, of course, we mustn't forget  King Arnulf's EXCELLENT eye for flower- arranging.
There is a smattering of applause. A few people pull thei robes up out of the wet. Erik leaps onto a wall and shout to the crowd.
Save yourselves! Hy-Brasil... is  sinking.
There are a lot of knowing smiles amongst the citizens.
Look, you don't know our safety  regulations.
It can't happen.
But it IS! Look!
(ignoring Erik) The important thing is not to panic.
Quite... yes... we understand...
I've already appointed the Chancellor  as Chairman of a committee to find  out exactly what IS going on, and  meantime I suggest we have a sing- song!
Good idea!
Can we do the one that goes "TUM-TI- TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TUM"?
Erik looks around in despair. Meanwhile in another street someone is struggling in the  floodwater.
I can't swim! I can't swim!
Relax!
I'm drowning! Help!
Loki grabs Keitel round the neck.
Let go!
But Keitel is pulled under. He re-emerges spluttering.
Urrgh! Argh! Let go, you idiot!
Help!
You'll drown us bo...
But they go under again. At this point Erik, Sven, Sven's dad and Harald swim round the corner, pushing the Horn  Resounding. They see the figures disappearing under the w
Help!
Help!

Erik, Sven and Co. swim as fast as they can to rescue the drowning pair. They struggle to overpower the panic-stric Loki, but he puts up a manic fight. Unexpectedly, Harald  Missionary suddenly unleashes a vicious right hook and la Loki out cold. There is a moment's stunned silence that i no unmingled with indignation.
(with hurt surprise) You hit him!
Well, it's what you're supposed to  do... isn't it?
Look!

They look up as Golden Dragon sails around a corner of th street, piloted by Aud. As the Vikings scramble aboard, t sound of the "sing-song" reaches a particularly noisy and discordant climax attract their attention.

head_text.subj: BACK IN WHAT WAS THE FORUM

text: A crowd of unconcerned-looking citizens is sitting on the last roof and just coming to the end of another appalling song.
...Te... Tum!
You know, I think we're getting  better.
(with genuine interest) How can you tell?
(a bit stumped) Er...
Father!
The King looks up.
It's all right! It isn't happening!
But, Father, it IS!
Get on board!
No THANKS!
Who do you think YOU are?
Panic-monger!
The roof is now sinking rapidly, though the citizens appe as unperturbed as ever.
Leave us alone!
Yeah. Leave 'em alone.
It's sinking! Hy-Brasil is sinking!
Well, my dear, I think you'll find  it's all a question of what you want  to believe in.... I have slightly  more experience of these matters  than you...
Unfortunately, at this point, the entire gathering of  citizens, the King and the Forum Temple disappear below t waves.
Father! (tears spring to her  eyes)
Harald Missionary has put his arm around Aud in a fatherl way.
There, my child... it's at times  like this that this book can be a  great help...
Erik shoos him away.
(with his usual  promptness) Right!
GOLDEN DRAGON spins alone in the wide ocean.
They are all gathered in front of the Horn Resounding.
(to himself) We must blow the first note... he  note that will take us to Asgaard...
(nervously and with  awe in his voice) Over the Edge of the World.
The other men look up at the Horn Resounding, and begin t feel a bit nervous.
We are going where only the dead  have been before...

Erik takes a deep breath and then puts his lips to the Ho Resounding. He blows. There is a splutter, and one or two the Vikings titter amongst themselves. He has another go. But again, all he produces is a pathetic spluttering.
(not unkindly in his  manner) Uh! Here! Give it to me!
Sven pushes Erik aside. Sven blow... he becomes redder an redder. But all he produces is a splutter. He gets a bit  angry.
Thor's blood!
Sven's dad looks heavenwards.
You're not using the right technique.
Sven's dad tries to take it over.
No! I'm doing it!
They start to struggle.
(getting angry) You're always telling me... TELLING  me!
Erik tries to separate them.
Sven!
(to his dad) Let me do something for myself for a  change!
Suddenly Aud comes forward.
No! Don't quarrel!
Sven and his dad stop fighting, surprised by the vehement her voice.
We'll never get where we want to go  if we fight.
Aud crosses to the Horn and inserts the mouthpiece. Loki  glances at Keitel. He hadn't bargained for this!
Er... don't blow it! You never know  WHAT might happen...
It has not spoken for a thousand  years... You must bring it to life  with a kiss...

She puts her lips to the mouthpiece and just touches it w them... almost a kiss... then... very gently... she begin to blow... a soft... slight note can just be heard... Aud takes her mouth away from the mouthpiece... and the soft  note goes on... reverberating... A sweet note... a magic  note... the Vikings stand stock-still, enchanted by the  sound... and the sound all the time is getting louder and the Horn begins to vibrate with the note. As the volume  increases the Golden Dragon itself begins to reverberate  with the sound. Rings of ripples begin to radiate out fro the boat across the calm water. The note grows louder and louder, and the Vikings, who at first were laughing and  cheering at Aud's success, begin to get rather alarmed. L and louder gets the note and the Horn shakes and the boat vibrates. Things start to be shaken loose, and fall onto deck. Ropes uncoil and run loose. A heavy block suddenly  crashes down to the deck, crowning Harald and laying him flat. Louder and louder grows the note, and the Vikings h to stop their ears for the pain. The water around the shi becomes more and more agitated. And then another sound is heard. It is the thunder of water in the distance like a  million distant waterfalls. And suddenly they notice the is running like a river -- all in one direction... sweepi the ship forward with incredible momentum. In no time the are engulfed in a mist, still traveling at a rate of knot Almost at once an appointed rock looms out of the mist ah of them. Erik flings himself at the steering oar, and eve is thrown about as the ship veers wildly and just misses rock, only to see another looming up ahead of them. The s veers again, as a third rock looms ahead. This time Sven grabbed a coil of rope, and as they pass the third rock, throws it like a lasso over the rock. Loki and Keitel lea to grab the rope just as the rope goes taut and the ship  comes to a lurching stop, anchored by the rope, but still swaying and buffeted in the racing waters. Those on board shout to each other, soaked to the skin. It is difficult make out what they are shouting.
Help!
What are you doing?
What d'you think? Help! Somebody  help us!
Shut up!
(pointing at Aud) She wants to kill us!
She wants to take us over the Edge  of the World!
You want to get to Asgaard, don't  you?
How do we know this is the way?
(shouting) We blew the Horn Resounding.
(screaming and pointing  an accusing finger  at Aud) SHE blew the Horn Resounding.
(shouting) Don't you see, Erik! She wants  revenge!
What are you talking about?
(to Keitel) Shut up!
She knows it was our fault!
Keep your mouth shut, Keitel!
No! It's YOU, Loki! I should never  have listened to you!
Loki looks around desperately.
You've lost your mind.
We came to stop you waking the Gods,  Erik! But I didn't want anyone to  get hurt!
You fool!
Suddenly Loki produces his stiletto and leaps onto Keitel stabbing at him.
I should have got rid of you long  ago!
Like you got rid of Snorri!
Erik tries to separate them.
No! No! We are in the spell of the  Horn! Hatred will destroy us.
That's right!
For a split second Erik is distracted. He looks across at Aud and for a moment he sees Freya standing there.
Once you are in the spell of the  Horn, hatred will destroy you...
Then it is Aud once more. But in that split second Loki h stabbed Erik.
Arrgh!
Erik staggers back clutching his arm. Keitel gives a roar rage, and picks Loki up bodily and hurls him out of the b into the maelstrom. The other Vikings look on aghast. Kei turns on them.
He killed Snorri! He caused the land  of Hy-Brasil to sink! SHE knew!
I didn't know!
Now she wants to send us over the  Edge of the World!
How else d'you think we're going to  get to Asgaard?
The Vikings look at each other amidst the roaring waters the thick spray. Erik holds his bleeding arm and looks at Aud. Should he trust her or not? Suddenly he turns on the others.
(shouting above the  din) Do YOU know the way to Asgaard, Keitel  Blacksmith?
Keitel shakes his head.
Do YOU know the way to Asgaard, Sven?
Sven shakes his head.
There is one road before us, and  that leads over the Edge of the World.
Harald sits up as he returns to consciousness.
There IS no Edge of the World.

Sven's dad bonks him again. Erik takes the rope and begin paying it out. With grim faces the Vikings turn and face  towards the roaring of the waters, as Erik edge the ship  further into the mist. The noise is deafening. It would b almost impossible to hear any voice above it. The faces of the Vikings betray their fear as they find  themselves emerging from out of the mist at the Edge of t World. They gape as they find themselves confronted by a  Waterfall of Seas -- stretching on either side of them -- far as the eye can see -- water falling and plunging over the lip of the world. And in front of them -- the blue sk continues on down and down until it shades into blackness strewn with stars beneath their feet... Sven, Sven's dad and Keitel edge to the prow and gasp.
No! Don't look over the Edge!

Erik lets out a little more rope, until the ship is protr over the edge. Sven, his dad and Keitel peer over the sid and stare down into the abyss. They gasp. From above we s the prow of Golden Dragon and the backs of the Vikings' h in plain view against a backdrop of stars below them.
Let me see!
Aud holds him back.
